A6F5D0B8C22A41CFB24AE3E2EEABAF85.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

4E50A8337F8741A1AE1D25322B8E238E.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

353DB848AEE44644B775A40B392B5775.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

8DA123F36CFE4794A61D4999D56A60E0.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

72705AE70DAD4E1D99B003663358313F.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

2D130AA98704422A9F94EF49390C43FA.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

C198DD3F29BD4117B055BCC4820AF43D.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

8F79C29F8C17403C9F2FF06A66C9B05C.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

DCF72DB1EE8A44A284A29C741E6EB136.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

40C29A418809443A896C41B79F7F052A.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

D5900062A0154F8B88559821BE574AD9.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

8BD86251253A404285F038109CE25218.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

71EDFF379E594665AB3B807F25413695.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

B56C9FA700D849599A6E7345B7184F54.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

B4AB23DF8C12419CAC7F1D0CB9C4E8E6.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

FDB45B79F40C4605950041B24E15353D.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code  job description; and, conflict resolution.

8E393B7E9F214999A7B2B945E5C5C5A2.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

8E2DB14199704CF0B686FE488DCAB238.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

18D16FF7FDB84174B8B81D0384018445.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

4FFE406D28194AE3AF06E1D5F4A165A5.description: Demonstrate a proficient knowledge of autobody by including a written self-assessment.

9E62A9505B8448FB837ACF6ACF4EFBF2.description: Present an advanced project to display the advancement of skills from previous projects.

BABEAF8E08524B15902E128D5710DFEC.description: Develop an advanced project utilizing guideline outlined in Module 32.

AA4CD3FB8E3844AB9199D309E883C047.description: Design, carry out and present an advanced project with self-assessment.

064C145BA7664E508532D4B55DEDD406.description: Examine upcoming technologies, trends and processes for aluminum welding in the autobody trade.

7C1351365DA94F13BB6A9637766EC22B.description: Investigate issues and potential solutions related to welding aluminum.

56581EB0A2BF4D9E8702A9329943DC05.description: Research effects of contamination on aluminum surfaces.

403763523B78461284929E884D6DC405.description: Compare processes and techniques used for aluminum and steel welding.

407FB406CAE646F4A539E3BB95C90FDB.description: Research different types of aluminum alloys commonly used in automotive construction.

4336AB97DBEE4A95978A9BC0022FF9EE.description: Examine materials and processes used to weld aluminum.

85363F7DF922444895D542D582D09DC4.description: Discuss own and peer’s alternate fuel automobile designs to provide feedback on the strengths and areas for improvement.

1A29417438144BD4BE5C5028ADCB42B9.description: Develop assessment criteria in consultation with peers and instructor to assess an innovative fuel automobile design.

0CB6D96BB3FF40439C77A890E57A28E8.description: Create, using drawing skills, computer-aided design programs or model-making, an innovative alternative fuel automobile considering factors such as new technologies, type of alternative fuel, fuel system integrity, protective barriers, occupant and autobody repairer safety and cost efficiency.

1D8D36A3FDA94B209BCF7960D62D2C86.description: Research insurance industry claims related to alternate fuel automobiles, including total loss.

345A72877D984A07AB91FD81AB29B931.description: Examine safety concerns with alternate fuel automobiles and the autobody trade.

3428E9EA37EA44C0B73540EB7EA2EEF5.description: Research the evolution of alternate fuel automobiles (e.g., full electric, hybrid, hydrogen, propane, natural gas) and characteristics of selected models.

0A4845738810440CA369AB6BD981FE74.description: Examine the evolution and characteristics of alternative fuel automobiles.

CD6CC548888F4DC8B724E220A3653884.description: Investigate current and future carbon footprints of aluminum in automobile design.

AC46983E4B4043279AE431835E3BFCF6.description: Explore career opportunities in aluminum repair (e.g., fishing boats and travel trailers/motorhomes).

95D8871690F54D12B8F6F7D38FB980FF.description: Determine appropriate corrosion protection products according to OEM specifications.

8AE4ED8F0AC24FD2A26AF9EFA4CD2EE5.description: Describe appropriate surface preparation procedures and appropriate tools for aluminum repair.

882F502A88464EE99346F6F0213DC37A.description: Identify aluminum repair techniques (e.g., welding, riveting, bonding) according to original equipment manufacturer (OEM) specifications.

DB1C351ED30B4ABD945C9F19AD257FF9.description: Research the composition (e.g., aluminum alloys, magnesium alloys) and grading of aluminum in automobile applications.

16DB149A2D0D48B3B1236843A2606239.description: Investigate the evolution and use of aluminum in automobile design.

B97AE422DA9D4076AACBB494E9FD5952.description: Examine the evolution and characteristics of aluminum in automobile design.

D85275C130CC469683301C54F65C443F.description: Investigate and describe short- and long-term health concerns related to body filling products and dust in the workplace.

B352F87417C14EA7B83FA565CFB0EC51.description: Examine the effects of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) on the environment.

64D517C448254AE7AAFCBF4E6478E824.description: Implement a plan to design and organize the workspace to prevent work-related injuries related to metal repair.

B34D7548322C46B09EA4BF286214D859.description: Recognize and follow safe work practices when using hand and power tools.

109D83DAC6B549DFA3A9BC0C68CCD0AA.description: Inspect repair and carry out adjustments as necessary to complete repair.

E6E56CD0328045C7AAB8055E0D658DD6.description: Repair major damage using picking tools, dent pullers, uni-spot pullers, body spoons, suction cups and hydraulic rams.

2A2FFE4A3D5A43E2A213548B7F74B8AC.description: Determine the amount of body filler needed to repair damage.

12979092A01E4EFAB657A9C6B31C3D5B.description: Remove damage from the least damaged area to the worst damaged area.

35EBD56E052A49DC9B6D007CBC4CC530.description: Remove glass and trim, if needed, before attempting to straighten metal.

A4756EAD8EAE4AD89D13D3CB0EF387DF.description: Identify all direct and indirect damage to panels.

BB5B32B105DB42B8BDA239201CEF8572.description: Demonstrate proper use of hand and power tools to contour metal.

326504D3494C4EF1A317942ACD924256.description: Prepare a cost estimate of the materials used for metal repair.

453ACC3DBFD843B08F8C57C124F13AB3.description: Identify the original point of impact to a panel from a collision to determine potential corrective repairs.

3BEA3B946430461E8EB087990EF1D7A5.description: Assess complex metal damage and carry out repairs.

B4191F96968E4AB09B0D3761684D56B7.description: Identify the conditions that make an automobile a total loss.

669A8B7E0CF544F2A73151757432C3E9.description: Determine the extent of the damage from outside the automobile and work inward and list everything by section that is bent, broken or missing.

2096A0BED9C043A0B6DEA211E2AD1B3E.description: Interpret technical service bulletins about potential issues that could result in the need for automobile repairs.

458C6E461CBB4CD18170D31CEDCFA9B8.description: Estimate damage repair costs including: detailed description of all labour operations that must be performed; complete list of parts and materials needed for the repair; and, total price including labour, parts, materials and applicable taxes.

1C3BB39C97AA4513A88E346E149BA458.description: Analyze the role of insurance in the autobody trade in Saskatchewan and elsewhere including: describing insurance, liability, waiver, total loss, premium, deductible and package policy; examining the role and responsibilities of the insurance adjuster/broker, automobile appraiser, automobile owner(s) and autobody repair shop; and, comparing original equipment manufacturer (OEM), recycled, remanufactured and after-market parts to repair an automobile.

0A9F664599024B1D87F714650228FCD9.description: Estimate the damage and time required to carry out repairs on an automobile.

4BEF3C299A774DC6B70058EEE0EE9677.description: Ensure all PPE is cleaned appropriately.

A61F4FD9F0814082826B55C8C34CE2E1.description: Identify the purpose and proper use and fit of personal protective equipment (PPE) required for welding, including eye protection (lens shades), clothing, hearing protection and footwear while identifying the hazards from which they protect individuals.

91ED08EAAA924B228398280EF7B7C9B6.description: Perform and analyze a variety of specified welds, including plug weld, spot weld, butt weld and lap weld.

3845AAC4B0CD4FDD9959BCBB2ECCF92E.description: Identify metals and perform preparation and assembly tasks prior to welding.

25E318DCB50745DFB9C435F3BAE74E65.description: Disassemble, clean and reassemble GMAW welder components.

58A0189FC63E4547B417DFB28ADC674E.description: Compare various types of wire and shielding gases used for GMAW.

864BD7E77BE64BBDB6995373645BD090.description: Explain the importance of employing correct start-up and shut-down procedures for GMAW equipment including checking and cleaning up the work station.

4433FDA2D234472EB4AF18B47FFCA9DF.description: Demonstrate knowledge of GMAW equipment such as nozzles, contact tips, liners, wire rolls, gauges and flow meters, amperage adjustment and voltage adjustment.

AF2BCA5B537C4A2CBEB5F73116536E4D.description: Use gas metal art welding (GMAW) equipment to complete specified autobody welds.

3CB32ED0C56D403F97A0C9B7C2FC3450.description: Implement a plan for a safe and healthy classroom and shop environment.

01AD085CBB6045E294414701812E538A.description: Assess the ergonomic design of the work space and implement appropriate procedures to ensure safety.

D451C16FED464690AA7662C30776124B.description: Apply safe and fair work practices, including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

6917E62C3B614DDBAF03C98C62BE34E6.description: Explain the proper procedures to follow to report a workplace injury.

0DB635906E1B4C5D83DA47CC45F78197.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury or material and equipment damage as a result of unsafe work acts or environments.

7015D0C1FE8D4F34857EE35EFA444110.description: Disconnect batteries and other power sources prior to undertaking autobody repairs where appropriate.

A7D7FAAAC6A8471586A4675D409EB210.description: Assess hazards and apply appropriate safety procedures when working in a confined space.

08C5349D530E4AF7BDB234A8453D697A.description: Assess the fire plan for the work area, including components such as fire alarms, fire extinguishers, exits and procedures, and make recommendations for improvements.

384E7726B900409EB55E72E3D24E6FF4.description: Identify, label, store and handle hazardous materials according to Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015).

57C6660D0B5B400DA4334ADB14204272.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE), including dust masks, approved respirators, coveralls, chemical resistant gloves, eye and hearing protection and footwear.

2DD7AF2647CC4E68803804EA413F6E7C.description: Apply injury prevention principles to ensure safe work performance in the autobody trade.
